title: How to Fish on Animal Crossing

steps.headline: Buy a fishing rod from Tom Nook.
steps.description: In Wild World, he sells the regular fishing rod for 500 bells. In City Folk, Tom sells both the fishing rod and the silver rod, both for 500 bells each, however, the silver rod is pretty rare. In New Horizons, you can purchase a fishing rod from Timmy for 400 Bells at Resident Services. If you wait until Day 2 in New Horizons, you can take Tom Nook's DIY course. He will give you the recipe to craft a flimsy fishing rod out of 5 tree branches at the crafting table in Resident Services. Purchase the Pretty Good Tools recipe from Tom Nooks shop to learn how to make a better fishing rod. In order to receive the golden fishing rod, a player must catch all of the fish in their designated game. The amount of fish are 40 in Animal Crossing, 56 in Wild World, 64 in City Folk, 72 in New Leaf, and 80 in New Horizons. In New Leaf and New Horizon, the fishing rod is sold at Timmy and Tommy's shop. You can get a silver or gold fishing rod at the Museum Shop after the Museum expansion.

steps.headline: Choose a fishing spot.
steps.description: Learn that different kinds of water carry different kinds of fish. Ocean: Very expensive fish, including sharks. The list includes barred knife-jaw, blue marlin, butterfly fish, clown fish, coelacanth, dab, football fish, hammerhead shark, horse mackerel, jellyfish, lobster, moray eel, napoleon fish, ocean sunfish, octopus, olive flounder, puffer fish, ray, red snapper, sea bass, sea butterfly, seahorse, shark, squid, surgeon fish, tuna, and zebra turkey-fish. River pool fish: The list includes catfish, giant catfish (only in Animal Crossing), gar, giant snake-head, and pond smelt. Waterfall fish: Char and large char can be found here. Large char is only available in Animal Crossing. Pond fish: Frogs, crawfish, and Killifish can be found here. River, waterfall, and pond: Unless they are categorized specifically, these can be found in any of the listed waters: angelfish, arapaima, arowana, barbel steed, bitterling, black bass, bluegill, carp, cherry salmon, crucian carp, dace, dorado, eel, freshwater goby, goldfish, guppy, king salmon, koi, loach, neon tetra, pale chub, pike, piranha, popeyed goldfish, rainbow trout, salmon, string fish, sweetfish, and yellow perch.

steps.headline: Equip the fishing rod.
steps.description: To equip the fishing rod, open your inventory and select the fishing rod. Then select Hold.

steps.headline: Look for silhouettes of fish.
steps.description: Fish that you can catch appear as shadows in the water. Do not move or run. This scares the fish away. In New Horizons, you can get fish to appear by using bait. To use bait, get the DIY recipe for fish bait. Then dig up a manilla clam on the shores using a shovel. Craft fish bait using the crafting table in Resident Service. Select the fish bait in your inventory and select Scatter food. This causes fish to appear.

steps.headline: Press the A button to cast the line.
steps.description: Try to cast your line so that the lure lands in front of the fish. This will make it easier for the fish to see your line.

steps.headline: Wait until the fish bites.
steps.description: A fish nibbles four or five times before a bite. Watch the bobber for when the fish bites. You will also hear a "bloop" sound when the fish bites. There would be times where a fish will nibble on the bait and swim away. If this happens, you'll need to recast your line.

steps.headline: Press the A button as soon as the fish bites.
steps.description: When the fish pulls the bobber below the water surface, press "A" immediately. There are some fish that you can be relaxed on to catch them, but there are others that you need precise timing to get them successfully.
